RevisionEvent.Note: Metadata created by OYU and SY

ResourceHeader.Description: This catalog is a list of coronal mass ejections (CMEs) observed by the COR1 instrument. COR1 is part of the Solar Terrestrial Relations Observatory (STEREO) mission, composed of twin spacecraft, the Behind-Earth and the Ahead-Earth spacecraft. It is the inner coronagraph of the Sun Earth Connection Coronal and Heliospheric Investigation (SECCHI) suite and has a field of view (FOV) from 1.4 to 4 solar radii. The catalog contains all CMEs manually identified since December 2006, which have width greater than 10 degrees, including faint events that are often missed by auto-detection methods. Events from STEREO-A and B are noted separately. The catalog consists of a set of monthly tables. Starting from solar cycle (SC) 25, the catalog was updated by including COR2 and LASCO C2 movies and links to in-situ interplanetary CMEs (ICMEs), particle events and type II radio data. Note that, in 2014, contact with STEREO-B was lost after entering an uncontrolled spin preventing its solar panels from generating enough power. After that the catalog contains only STEREO-A events. In addition, there is data gap between 2014 and 2015 for STEREO-A due to its position almost directly behind the sun and it was transmitting only a weak signal or occasionally none. STEREO-A resumed its normal operation in November 2015. The description of the parameters is given in accordance with the order in 2022.
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement:
When any of these data is used, please cite one or more of the following publications as appropriate:
* Angelos Vourlidas et al, The Coronal Mass Ejection Visibility Function of Modern Coronagraphs, 2020, ApJ, 900, 161. * H. Xie, N. Gopalswamy, and S. Akiyama, The Structural Connection between Coronal Mass Ejection Flux Ropes near the Sun and at 1 AU, 2021, ApJ, 922, 64. * H. Xie, O. C. St. Cyr, P. Mäkelä, N. Gopalswamy, Statistical Study on Multispacecraft Widespread Solar Energetic Particle Events During Solar Cycle 24, 2019, JGR Space Physics, 124, 6384-6402.

InformationURL.Name: Publication
InformationURL.Description: Xie, H., N. Gopalswamy and S. Akiyama, The Structural Connection between CME Flux Ropes near the Sun and at 1 AU, ApJ, 922,64,2021. Description: Comparison of flux rope structures among solar source regions, CMEs in the corona, and MCs at 1 AU, using STEREO COR1/COR2, SOHO, EUVI/SDO EUV, and in-situ measurements. DOI 10.3847/1538-4357/ac23cc

Parameter.Name: Date (STEREO SECCHI COR1-B)
Parameter.Description: Date of observation of CME on STEREO-B.

Parameter.Name: UT (STEREO SECCHI COR1-B)
Parameter.Description: Time of observation of CME on STEREO-B.

Parameter.Name: ANG_SEP (B, A) w/Ear)
Parameter.Description: Separation angle between STEREO A and B and Earth

Parameter.Name: Date (STEREO SECCHI COR1-A)
Parameter.Description: Date of observation of CME on STEREO-A.

Parameter.Name: Time (STEREO SECCHI COR1-A)
Parameter.Description: Date of observation of CME on STEREO-A.

Parameter.Name: Images/ Event
Parameter.Description: Number of events and COR1 and COR2 movies

Parameter.Name: Comments
Parameter.Description: A brief description of observed event features, including CME rough location, brightness, width, and morphology.

Parameter.Name: In-situ & Radio Beacon Data
Parameter.Description: links to STEREO-A in-situ and radio beacon data.

Parameter.Name: ICME
Parameter.Description: Link to the Interplanetary Coronal Mass Ejections (CME) data

Parameter.Name: SEP
Parameter.Description: Links to the data for solar energetic particle (SEP) events.
